title: Drawing, "Decorative Panel: Fames Supporting a Swag beneath a Medallion", 1759–95
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and gray and brown wash, white gouache on  white laid paper
markings:
Cooper Union Museum stamp on the verso
watermark: none
inscribed:
Inscribed on the recto in graphite along the upper margin: dessin original de Prieur
Inscribed on the recto in pen and black ink along the lower margin: Purchased by Miss Eleanor G Hewitt
Inscribed on the recto in graphite along the lower right margin: 5
description: Horizontal composition in which two winged female figures with trumpets/horns hold a swag, each at one end.  Above the swag, at the center of the composition, is a medallion, suspended in the air. It is decorated with a face. The composition is set against a dark background.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Decorative Panel: Fames Supporting a Swag beneath a Medallion", 1759–95.
1759–95. Pen and black ink, brush and gray and brown wash, white gouache on  white laid paper. Gift of Eleanor Garnier Hewitt. 1931-65-39.
